basic.floral_language:
Sedum sediforme
Floriography: kind, independent, firm.
A compact plant, leaves long olive shaped, arranged like Indian lotus blooms, with white powder covered, green but turning into red if received enough sunlight. It becomes a popular succulent plant because it is easy to grow.
The plant requires sunny habitat. It will go through dormancy in summer and should be remove from direct sunlight to a place with scattered light. Yellow flower could bloom from where leaves open.
basic.origin: Temperate and tropical high mountains in Northern Hemisphere
basic.blooming: Succulent plants, often flowers in spring and summer, yellow flowers
basic.color: Leaf color green, when sunny leaf color turning to red

maintenance.soil: Peat and akadama mixed in 3:1 ratio
maintenance.sunlight: Likes light, and resistant to half shade, short period of dormancy in summer, use half shade for better care
maintenance.watering: Very resistant to drought, water thoroughly when soil is dry, 1-2 times a month in frequency
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply once every month
maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and rotten part timely
